Topic.Title: Lost my portfolio on my home page.

Message.Msg: I posted a reply earlier and it disappeared. Maybe yahoo is getting rid of everything. Lost my portfilio at about 6am same as everyone. I vist yahoo very often every day because of the portfilio and without that I see no reason to use yahoo. Hope it is a glitch but my fear it is a stupid idea. I have been prompted to enter my password to access portfolios several times in the last few weeks which I thought was really odd as it didn't ask me to re-signin to my yahoo.

Message.Title: A Yahoo Announcement we would like to see
Message.Msg: Yahoo has hired a Dlirector of Integrity. This former government agent in charge of a cyber crime division will be charged with returing ingtegrity to Yahoo. Her first task will be the elimination of cyber criminals from these boards - by removing their Yahoo ID's and working with local law inforcement agents to bring criminal charges.. She will also have the authority to demote or terminate Yahoo employees who have failed Yahoo and its shareholders by not enforcing accepted standards of integrity. She will also have the authority to investigate Yahoo's outside CPA - PricewaterhouseCoopers - for their failure to report on this issue. Of course, this won't happen, but wouldn't it be great if someone at Yahoo finally took integrity seriously.

Topic.Title: Alibaba Group To Name IPO Advisers Week of February 18

Message.Msg: I think you are right. Alibaba IPO at $60 billion is a huge win for Yahoo. When Yahoo turns around revenue and starts to show growth later this year, we'll probably see more stock price appreciation. I actually believe the target Yahoo will hit by next January is $40. With their stakes in Alibaba and Yahoo Japan and the cash they have in the bank now and the $1 billion annual earnings, Yahoo will have (After taxes) about $20 billion in cash. At $40, with share buyback taking shares down to 1 billion shares, a market cap of $40 billion and $20 billion of cash, an acquiring company would be paying an effective price of $20 billion. IMHO

Topic.Title: Alibaba Group To Name IPO Advisers Week of February 18

Message.Msg: Man, if Yahoo's stake of Yahoo Japan ends up being worth more than their stake in Alibaba, that would mean BILLIONS more for Yahoo. This is the stock to own for 2013. Huge upside with minimal downside.
